info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 1:59AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Chesterfield, central Henrico and southeastern Powhatan Counties and the City of Richmond through 230 AM EDT... At 158 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Moseley, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Chesterfield Court House around 210 AM EDT. Bon Air and University Of Richmond around 215 AM EDT. Downtown Richmond, Bensley and Bellwood around 220 AM EDT. Richmond, Virginia Commonwealth University, Virginia Union University and Lakeside around 225 AM EDT. East Highland Park around 230 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Winterpock, Richmond Heights, Midlothian, Montrose, Pocahontas State Park, Skinquarter, Beach, Greendale, Roslyn Hills and Varina. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
